citation.case_name: Converse v. Minnesota Thresher Mfg. Co

html:
212 U.S. 567

29 S.Ct. 691

53 L.Ed. 654

THEODORE R. CONVERSE, Receiver, etc., Plaintiff in Error,
v.
AETNA NATIONAL BANK THEODORE R. CONVERSE, Receiver, etc Plaintiff in Error, v. FIRST NATIONAL BANK OF SUFFIELD

No. 76.

No. 75.

January 25, 1909.

1

Messrs. William Waldo Hyde and Charles Welles Gross for plaintiff in error.

2

Messrs. Gardiner Greene, Frank T. Browne, and Charles E. Serles for defendants in error.

3

Per Curiam: Judgments reversed with costs, on the authority of Bernheimer v. Converse, 206 U. S. 516, 51 L. ed. 1163, 27 Sup. Ct. Rep. 755, and cases remanded for further proceedings in conformity to law.
html_lawbox:
212 U.S. 567 (1909)

CONVERSE
v.
MINNESOTA THRESHER MFG. CO.
SAME
v.
FIRST NATIONAL BANK OF SUFFIELD.

Nos. 75, 76.

Supreme Court of United States.

Argued January 14, 1909.
Decided January 25, 1909.
ERROR TO THE SUPREME COURT OF ERRORS OF CONNECTICUT.

*568 Mr. Wm. Waldo Hyde and Mr. Charles Welles Gross for plaintiff in error.

No appearance for defendants in error.

Per Curiam:

Judgments reversed with costs on the authority of Bernheimer v. Converse, 206 U.S. 516, and cases remanded for further proceedings in conformity to law.
